Article Title: Maha Kumbh stampede: 'As panic struck, people scattered, cries for help replaced holy chants'
Article Text:
Photographers Basabdatta Sarkar and Krishna Roy recount their experience at Prayagraj's Mauni Amavasya where an incident led to panic. Amid holy chants, a sudden pushback and screams marked the tragic scene at the sacred riverbank, highlighting the dangers of overcrowding during such massive gatherings.

At 1am, we joined the flow of humanity. We were 30m from the photographers' stage when the crowd suddenly stopped," write TOI photographers Basabdatta Sarkar & Krishna Roy. "There was a pushback, followed by screams... Holy chants turned to cries for help."Since we arrived Sunday in Prayagraj, all we heard were chants of "Har Har Gange" and "Har Har Mahadev" as millions of devotees made their way to Triveni Sangam. All drawn by the faith that bathing in the holy waters can lead to salvation.Wednesday, we knew, was the big day - Mauni Amavasya - the most auspicious of the six dates for the Amrit Snan. Crores of faithful were expected. Though there were six ghats, it was Sangam that drew everyone. There was a short window till 4am for devotees before only sadhus were allowed access to the river.By 1am, we joined the flow of humanity - not to bathe, but to reach a photographers' platform, hoping to capture the scale of this grand spiritual gathering. We were just 30m from the stage when the crowd suddenly stopped. A sharp pushback came, followed by piercing screams. First women, then children and men. "Something must have happened. Is it a stampede?" was our first thought.As panic took over, people rushed in all directions. We sprinted to the platform and somehow climbed up. From there, we saw a sea of heads bobbing up and down, with some suddenly getting sucked in and disappearing. The holy chants had been replaced by desperate cries for help.Soon, police whistles, ambulance sirens, and the sight of RAF personnel and mounted police filled the air. It felt like an eternity before the ambulances finally left, carrying the dead and injured. The aftermath was haunting - an eerie silence, broken only by the occasional cries of children, heaps of discarded clothes, footwear, and bags covered the ground, more than we had ever seen in our lives. We only hoped no one was trapped beneath them.We gathered our thoughts and cameras. We had come to capture vignettes of a vibrant spiritual celebration. We are leaving with frames of a heartbreaking tragedy.
Article Summary: At 1am, we joined the flow of humanity. We were 30m from the photographers' stage when the crowd suddenly stopped," write TOI photographers Basabdatta Sarkar & Krishna Roy. The aftermath was haunting - an eerie silence, broken only by the occasional cries of children.

Article Title: Princess Diana: Prince Harry reveals contacting late mother Princess Diana through psychic in his memoir 'Spare'
Article Text:
File photo: Princess Diana with young William and Harry (Picture credit: X)

Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana, who passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday, The Mirror reported.The Duke received a message from his mother through the psychic, who told him, "You're living the life she wanted for you." Harry, now 40, says that the medium also told him his mother was with him "right now," which made his neck warm and his eyes fill with tears. The psychic shared that Diana knew Harry was "looking for clarity" and "feels your confusion." She added that Diana understood Harry had "so many questions" and that answers would come in time.Another anecdote involved Prince Harry’s son, Archie. The psychic reportedly described how Diana’s spirit witnessed Archie accidentally breaking a Christmas tree ornament shaped like Queen Elizabeth. When asked, Harry admitted the incident had occurred, adding that Archie had attempted to fix the ornament.The medium suggested Diana found humour in the situation, delighting in the antics of her grandson she never had the chance to meet.In Spare, Prince Harry also recounts an extraordinary encounter with a leopard during a trip to Botswana with his brother, Prince William. He interpreted the animal’s presence as a comforting sign from his late mother, suggesting that "everything will be fine." However, the experience was not without fear, as he briefly worried the leopard might attack.Harry has been candid about the psychological toll of losing Diana so young. As reported by The Mirror, he disclosed a haunting period after her death when he entertained the possibility that she had staged her demise. His anguish led him to repeatedly drive through the Paris tunnel where Diana’s life was cut short, attempting to make sense of the tragedy.
Article Summary: Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana. Diana passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday.

Dubai has been long celebrated as a global retail haven, and is now making waves in the world of artificial intelligence (AI). Known for its expansive malls and top-tier brands, the city is seamlessly blending tradition with technology to reshape how consumers shop, interact with brands, and experience retail.Behind the luxurious displays and bespoke offerings lies a layer of AI-powered innovation that’s redefining personalisation, streamlining operations, and enhancing customer satisfaction. From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape.In today’s retail environment, customers seek experiences that resonate on a personal level. AI has emerged as the linchpin of this transformation. Amreen Iqbal , Founder and Creative Director of Piece of You, a custom jewellery brand in Dubai, emphasises the depth of this shift: “It’s about understanding the customer deeper—what they want, how they want it, and how we can make it special and unique to each customer. AI helps us do that.”Her brand employs AI-powered tools to enable customers to design unique jewellery pieces through virtual try-ons and bespoke customisation. “The ability to personalise jewellery at this level was unthinkable a few years ago. Now, with AI, it’s a reality,” she adds.Similarly, global e-commerce innovations have gained traction in Dubai. Sue Azari , an e-commerce consultant at, notes, “AI enables highly customised and intuitive customer experiences.”She cites Zalando’s AI-powered chatbot as a perfect example: “If you need an outfit for a Christmas party, you simply describe your needs, and the chatbot curates a complete look, including accessories. It’s like having a personal shopper who knows your wardrobe.”In the beauty sector, major players like Sephora are redefining the customer journey with AI. Through augmented reality (AR) and AI features, their app enables users to virtually try on products like lipstick shades while integrating seamless social sharing options. Azari explains, “It’s about creating an experience, not just a transaction.”Walid BenOthman, Managing Director at Bitpanda, in Dubai, added that AI-driven personalisation has created a 25% improvement in customer satisfaction, revenue, or cost reduction. “Additionally, AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants provide 24/7 customer support, improving engagement and customer satisfaction.”He explained AI has made it easy to bring in hyper-personalised advertisements by analysing customer behaviour, creating more effective campaigns and higher conversion rates.Adding to Dubai’s retail innovation is the launch of theat Dubai Mall, as reported. The AI-powered store enhances the telecom retail experience by offering an array of cutting-edge features. Using AI and robotics, customers can explore products, make payments, and even collect purchases from automated lockers.The store is equipped with advanced facial recognition technology, enabling personalised interactions and tailored product suggestions. It epitomises Dubai’s vision to merge physical retail with AI-driven efficiency. As highlighted in several news reports, this initiative underscores Dubai’s commitment to revolutionising traditional retail through technology. report by GoGlobe has highlighted that Dubai AI’s impact extends beyond personalisation, revolutionising how brands market their products. Generative AI (genAI) has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements and streamlining content creation.“AI doesn’t just generate content; it analyses performance metrics to refine strategies in real-time. It saves marketers countless hours and ensures campaigns are efficient and impactful,” explains Azari.Iqbal highlights AI’s ability to enhance marketing precision through predictive analytics, helping businesses target audiences with unparalleled accuracy. From creating dynamic ads to optimising email campaigns, AI ensures that every touchpoint is relevant and impactful.At Amazon, for instance, AI-generated product descriptions have not only increased efficiency but also improved SEO performance and consistency. “This is not just automation; it’s about making marketing smarter and more strategic,” notes Azari.While customers benefit from AI-driven personalisation, its operational applications are equally transformative. Gavin Jackson, Senior Vice President of Data and AI at Endava, highlights the role of AI in inventory management: “AI has turned inventory management into a science. Retailers can now accurately predict demand, ensuring shelves are stocked without over-ordering. It’s a win for both businesses and consumers.”Jackson explains that AI-powered systems can even trigger additional production when products start selling out, ensuring businesses never miss a sales opportunity. Logistics and supply chains are also undergoing an AI-driven revolution, with systems optimising delivery routes, warehouse layouts, and energy consumption. “It’s about creating an interconnected ecosystem where every touchpoint is as efficient as possible,” he adds.Dubai’s embrace of AI is propelling the city into a new era of retail excellence. By integrating advanced technologies across personalisation, marketing, and operations, the city is not only enhancing customer experiences but also setting a global standard for innovation in retail.As Iqbal aptly puts it, “The ability to create personalised, meaningful experiences isn’t just a luxury—it’s a necessity. And AI makes it possible.”Dubai’s commitment to leveraging AI ensures that its reputation as a global retail hub remains stronger than ever, firmly rooted in innovation and customer-centricity.

From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape. Generative AI has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements.

Article Title: Xavier Trudeau Music Debut: Justin Trudeau's son Xavier debuts music career with R&B track ‘Til the Night’s Done’
Article Text:
Justin Trudeau's son Xavier debuts music career with R&B track ‘Til the Night’s Done’ (Picture credit: X)

Xavier James Trudeau, the 17-year-old son of outgoing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, is stepping into the spotlight with the launch of his music career. Over the weekend, Xavier shared a teaser video on Instagram for his debut R&B single, ‘ Til the Night’s Done ', set to release on February 21, 2025.The promotional clip shows Xavier walking across a bridge at night, delivering lines like, “We could roll some, we could light one.” While the lyrics sparked speculation about a nod to cannabis—legalized in Canada by Justin Trudeau in 2018—the overall response has been overwhelmingly positive.Xavier’s debut marks a departure from his father’s political legacy, with Montreal-based musician Dan Boeckner joking on X: “I’m actually fine with this AS LONG AS Trudeau Jr Jr is formally banned from entering politics for the rest of his natural life.”Sophie Grégoire Trudeau , Xavier’s mother and Justin Trudeau’s ex-wife, expressed her support with a comment on the post: “Great work, guys!” Justin Trudeau, who announced his resignation as Prime Minister earlier this month, has yet to comment on his son’s music debut.Fans and critics alike weighed in on Xavier’s Instagram teaser. Some praised his artistry, with comments like, “Congrats for making a song; hope you blow up!” while others were less enthused, posting remarks such as, “Just put the fries in the bag bro.”Xavier’s foray into music follows a tumultuous period for the Trudeau family. Justin and Sophie announced their separation in 2023 after nearly two decades of marriage. The couple shares three children: Xavier, 14-year-old Ella-Grace, and 9-year-old Hadrien.Justin Trudeau announced his intention to step down as Prime Minister earlier this month, emphasizing the importance of a competitive process to select the next leader of the Liberal Party. As Trudeau transitions out of office, his eldest son seems ready to carve his own path—this time, not in politics, but in music.

A gale warning is an official alert issued by national meteorological agencies to inform the public and maritime communities of strong, sustained winds reaching speeds of 34-47 knots (39-54 mph or 63-88 km/h).These warnings are critical for saving lives and minimizing property damage in coastal and maritime regions.According to Surfer Today, a gale is a powerful surface wind, categorised between 7 and 10 on the Beaufort Wind Force Scale , an empirical tool developed in 1805 by Sir Francis Beaufort. The scale helps estimate wind speeds based on observable conditions, such as whitecaps on waves, tree movements, and structural damage.For example:The term "gale" originates from the Old Norse word gala (to scream), reflecting the loud, howling sound of strong winds .Gale-force winds occur when air moves rapidly between areas of high and low pressure. Coastal regions , estuaries, and even inland seas often experience these conditions.As per Surfer Today, specific topographies, like San Francisco Bay or Cape Town's Table Mountain, can funnel and intensify winds into gales.National meteorological agencies, such as the National Weather Service (NWS) in the United States, issue gale warnings. These alerts are part of their responsibilities, including real-time weather updates, hazardous weather warnings , and shipping forecasts.According to Surfer Today, gale warnings are maritime-specific in the US, with wind advisories issued for land-based events. Warnings are typically disseminated via FM broadcasts, television, VHF radio, official apps, and even flag or pennant systems at sea. Article Title: Raising Financially Savvy Kids: Age-Appropriate Money Management Education for the Next Generation
Article Text:

By Tvisha Tuli, Content Creator

Start Early with a Modest Allowance: Consider providing your children with a small monthly allowance that introduces them to the concept of budgeting and the value of earning money through contributing to household chores. Make Saving a Game: Start small, perhaps with a reward system tied to their favorite pastimes. By linking their efforts to tangible rewards, such as completing chores to play video games, the habit of budgeting gets cultivated and seamlessly transitions into saving real money. Teach Budgeting Using the 50:30:20 Rule: This is a simple yet powerful tool that teaches them to allocate 50% of their money for needs, like food and clothing, 30% for wants, such as toys or treats, and 20% for savings . This approach helps children discern between needs and wants while cultivating patience in their financial journey. Make Learning Fun with Board Games: Incorporate board games like Monopoly, Game of Life, etc., into family game nights. These games not only entertain but also impart valuable lessons on financial planning, decision-making, and the significance of saving and investing. Explore Age-Appropriate Books: Invest in age-appropriate books that emphasize the importance of saving and financial responsibility, from colorful stories for younger audiences to more sophisticated guides for older children. Encourage Smart Shopping : Take children along when shopping and show them how to compare prices. Teach them to look for good deals and bargains, instilling resourcefulness and a strong sense of stewardship.

If the world is a giant machine, money is the fuel that keeps it running smoothly. From buying groceries to raising funds, money is at the heart of almost everything we do. That's why understanding how money works is so crucial in today's world.However, in the schoolyard of life, the curriculum often skips over the ABCs of financial literacy .Hence, it becomes imperative for parents to step into the role of headmasters, ensuring their children are equipped with more than just algebra and history. Just as parents meticulously prepare their children for exams and extracurricular activities, they must also take the reins in imparting essential lessons on money management . When one knows how to budget, save, and spend wisely, one is better prepared to handle everyday situations like paying bills, or even planning for big goals like college or a career.Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest; it's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. From an early age, children absorb lessons about money, whether consciously or unconsciously, from their surroundings. Therefore, it's incumbent upon parents, educators, and policymakers to ensure that these lessons are deliberate and conducive to financial well-being. Just as we teach children the alphabet before they can read, we should introduce basic financial concepts before they encounter their first paycheck.Here are practical steps that parents can incorporate into their child-rearing journey to ensure a lifetime of sound financial habits:By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults, capable of making informed decisions, pursuing their dreams, and contributing meaningfully to society. As these empowered individuals enter the workforce and engage in economic activities, they will not only secure their financial well-being but cultivate a stronger, more resilient economy for generations to come.

Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here’s what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone – Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25 Ultra is designed to impress the consumers. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy.We got the chance to spend some time with the new Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra and here’s our first impressions of the new Samsung smartphone.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra has borrowed its design aesthetics from its predecessor. The most expensive S series smartphone from Samsung continues the trend of refined aesthetics with a squared-off titanium frame and Gorilla Glass Armor 2. The Gorilla Glass Armor 2 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra is scratch resistant and it also provides anti-reflective glass ceramic cover the the smartphone. The design is both durable and elegant, with a slimmer and lighter build compared to its predecessors. The phone now features smoother, rounded corners, making it more comfortable to hold. The ride side of the smartphone houses the volume rockers and the power button. Apart from waking up the smartphone, the users can also use the power button to activate Google Gemini. The bottom part of the smartphone houses the USB Type C charging case, the slot for S Pen and the SIM card tray. The front is dominated by a 6.9-inch AMOLED display and the rear of the smartphone houses the quad-camera setup placed neatly in the top right corner. The smartphone also comes with IP68 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The overall build of Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra exudes sophistication, maintaining its status as a flagship device.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra sports a 6.9-inch Quad HD+ Infinity-O-Edge AMOLED display. The display on the smartphone offers a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz. The screen is protected with a coating of Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass which makes it resistant to scratches. We really liked the display on the flagship Samsung smartphone. It offers a crisp resolution, smooth 120Hz adaptive refresh rate, and enhanced Vision Booster for vivid outdoor viewing. Samsung has further enhanced brightness levels, making it easy to view even under harsh sunlight. The colour accuracy and HDR performance ensure vibrant visuals, whether you're gaming or streaming videos.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by Android’s most powerful and advanced chipset – Snapdragon 8 Elite. The smartphone comes in three variants – 12GB+256GB, 12GB+512GB and 12GB + 1TB. The smartphone performed well during our initial testing and we didn’t face any lag. We had a smooth experience during multitasking and gaming. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is backed by a 5,000 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support. The smartphone also supports Qi wireless charging. Samsung claims that the smartphone can charge from 0to 65% in just 30 minutes. However, we are yet to test this functionality and the battery backup of the smartphone. The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with an in- display fingerprint sensor and sports a quad rear camera setup.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra runs Android 15 operating system topped with the company's own layer of One UI 7. Samsung has also confirmed that the Galaxy S25 Ultra will get seven years of OS and security updates. Coming to One UI 7, the AI integration in One UI 7 feels more intuitive, with features like natural language search and context-aware multitasking. The AI features of the OS come with a significant new look, based on a new notification system that streamlines communication with easy access from the device's lock screen. It includes Now Bar, which highlights relevant activities across various features like Interpreter, Music, Recording, Stopwatch and more. One UI 7 also reduces visual clutter and offers a simplified homescreen, redesigned One UI widgets, and lock screen which enhances the user experience. We will talk more about the software in our detailed review of the smartphone.Same as its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra also sports a quad rear camera setup. The rear camera consists of 200MP main camera with f/1.7 aperture, 50MP ultra wide sensor with f/1.9 aperture, 10MP telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom and f/2.4 aperture and 50MP periscope telephoto lens for 5x optical zoom and f/3.4 aperture. Front houses a 12MP selfie camera with f/2.2 aperture. The camera delivered some really impressive results during our initial testing. The primary sensor on the Galaxy S25 Ultra manages to capture incredible detail and dynamic range. The AI enhancements bring sharper portraits and more accurate colour reproduction. Features like depth-of-field control and Galaxy Log enhance creative possibilities and help users do much more with the camera. Also, the redesigned camera UX allows more intuitive control over advanced settings. Camera buttons, controls, and modes have been reorganised to make it easier to find the features you need and to give you a clearer preview of the picture you’re taking or the video you're recording. For the detailed camera analysis, you will have to wait for our detailed review.Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra feels like a refined iteration of an already impressive formula. Its snappier UI, AI enhancements, and polished design make it a top contender in the flagship smartphone segment. The smartphone offers a sleek design and all the high-end and powerful specifications. But will that be enough? Wait for our detailed review to find out more.
Article Summary: Samsung launched its most expensive Galaxy S-series smartphone – Galaxy S25 Ultra at its first Galaxy Unpacked event of 2025 in San Jose, US. The smartphone comes with a starting price tag of Rs 1,29,999 and it packs in a lot of features and looks like a compelling buy. With its sleek design, powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, and top-tier camera capabilities, the S25Ultra is designed to impress the consumers.

Article Title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shares selfie with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, teasing major partnership updates
Article Text:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman breaks silence DeepSeek



In a recent social media post by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman , the AI leader stirred excitement by sharing a selfie with Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella . The image was captioned, "Next phase of the msft x oai partnership is gonna be much better than anyone is ready for!!"Altman's post quickly gained attention, generating anticipation for the future of the collaboration between OpenAI and Microsoft.Nadella responded to the post with enthusiasm, saying, "Looking forward to all that’s ahead!"The strategic partnership between OpenAI and Microsoft has been instrumental in integrating cutting-edge AI technologies into various products, such as Azure and Microsoft 365. Altman's comments, made during a recent interview and a series of posts on X, formerly known as Twitter, have caught the attention of the tech community. Altman acknowledged the rapid rise of DeepSeek and their AI model, DeepSeek R1, which has gained significant traction in various markets.Altman praised DeepSeek's efforts, stating, "DeepSeek's R1 is an impressive model, particularly around what they're able to deliver for the price,” and even highlighted the invigorating nature of having new competition. However, he remained confident in OpenAI's ability to stay ahead in the AI race. "We will obviously deliver much better models and also it’s legit invigorating to have a new competitor! We will pull up some releases," Altman posted on X.

Article Title: ACT Fibernet introduces ACT SmartWi-Fi powered by AI
Article Text: ACT Fibernet (Atria Convergence Technologies Ltd) in partnership with Aprecomm.ai has upgraded its router OS to ACT Zippy. ACT Zippy is a proprietary router OS that improves in-home Wi-Fi experience on all your devices, all your applications, in any part of your house, 24x7.ACT Zippy, which is now installed on all routers, transforms traditional Wi-Fi connectivity into a smart and intelligent service.By leveraging AI, ACT Zippy proactively scans and monitors your in-home Wi-Fi, identifying potential interferences and optimizing Wi-Fi experience in real-time using channel switching, band steering and other advanced features.Speaking at the launch, Ravi Karthik, Chief Marketing and Customer Experience Officer for ACT Fibernet, said, “In line with ACT Fibernet’s brand promise of ‘Feel the Advantage’, we are now launching a unique and industry-first, AI-powered Wi-Fi which scans your unique home environment and automatically improves wi-fi experience for all connected devices.With the number of devices connected to a home wi-fi, increasing significantly, providing a superior wi-fi experience is our key focus area. Under ACT SmartWi-fi we have planned a series of products and innovations in the home Wi-fi space that will address this issue and significantly enhance in-home wi-fi experience.”All customers onboarded in select cities from January 10 will be on the ACT SmartWi-Fi platform. For ACT’s existing customers, who are eligible for Smart Wi-Fi update will be auto updated in a phased manner. All these upgrades come at no extra cost to all eligible customers.
Article Summary: ACT Zippy is a proprietary router OS that improves in-home Wi-Fi experience on all your devices, all your applications, in any part of your house, 24x7. By leveraging AI, ACT Zippy proactively scans and monitors your in- home Wi-fi, identifying potential interferences.

Article Title: Cred gets RBI approval to launch CBDC, unveils E-Rupee wallet in partnership with Yes Bank
Article Text: Cred, the fintech platform has become the first non-bank entity to successfully roll out the e-Rupee wallet. This move is part of the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) initiative, which aims to revolutionise digital transactions in India.The Cred e-Rupee wallet , launched in partnership with Yes Bank, allows users to send and receive funds using a UPI-linked interface.This beta version is currently available to a select group of members who have completed the video Know Your Customer (KYC) process. The wallet comes with a daily transaction limit of Rs 50,000 and a per-transfer limit of Rs 10,000.Kunal Shah, founder of Cred, said, “With the support of the RBI, we’re enabling the creditworthy to shape the future of digital currency in the world’s fastest-growing economy. Our goal is to make e-Rupee transactions simple and encourage its adoption among our members.”The e-Rupee, or digital rupee , is a legal tender issued by the RBI in digital form. It functions similarly to physical cash, offering the convenience of instant, programmable transactions. Users can store and transact e-Rupee through wallets provided by various banks and non-banks like CRED, making person-to-person (P2P) and person-to-merchant (P2M) payments seamlessThe CRED e-Rupee wallet includes features such as programmable merchant payments and integration with CRED Pay. Future updates will introduce more functionalities, including PCI-less transactions for amounts below Rs 500 and expanded access to all CRED members.
Article Summary: Cred, the fintech platform has become the first non-bank entity to successfully roll out the e-Rupee wallet. This move is part of the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) initiative.

His journey emphasizes the importance of embracing neurodiversity in personal and professional growth.
